Text: I was first officer on an old tin can. We were on a surveying flight, off from McMurdo.
Our route was towards the western end of the Getz ice shelf, to photograph unmapped areas inland.
As we passed the Flood Range, our navigator thought he saw something in the crevasses below. A glow like fire, and our plane shut down.
We nearly died, trying to glide the plane down safely. But our problems didn't end there, and we soon had unexpected visitors.
